page.title: 10The Canham's Family Life
page.content: The day starts early in the Canham household at 7am. Mum packs Dad's lunch before he goes to work on the farm at 7.30.Mum washes up and dresses Graham,who is eighteen months old. Tracey and Angela go to Scalford School on the 8.20 bus. Mum does housework until 10 when she and Graham have a drink. Mum works at home, linking socks by machine while Graham plays. After dinner at 12 Graham goes to sleep while Mum links socks again. When Graham wakes,Mum starts tea. The girls come home at 4pm. After tea while they watch television and play,Mum does housework and baths Graham. The girls' bedtime is 8.30,the time that Dad comes home from work if it is harvest time. At other times of the year Dad is home by 4pm. Graham goes to bed around 10pm followed by Mum and Dad at the end of a busy day.
